critique: This document is a withdrawal of public lands in California from settlement, location, sale, or entry to protect and augment the city of Los Angeles' water supply system. It was issued under the authority of an act of Congress. It does not seem to have a strong ideological tilt, nor does it directly address immigration, executive power, national security, economic regulation, or social inclusion. The federalism aspect is slightly tilted towards federal primacy as it involves federal lands and a federal order impacting a local water supply. The action is authorized by congress, so the executive power is neutral.
